Package com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.steps

Class AbstractSteps<T extends AbstractStep<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.steps.AbstractSteps<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the steps.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Steps, TypeSteps
    public abstract class AbstractSteps<T extends AbstractStep<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Statusable
    Describes multiple steps.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSteps

        public AbstractSteps()
        Creates an AbstractSteps with an empty list.

      • AbstractSteps

        public AbstractSteps​(java.util.List<T> steps)
        Creates AbstractSteps with the specified list of Steps.
        Parameters:
        steps - The list of steps that specify the behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public void test()
        Executes all Steps.
        If an exception or error occurs in any step, the steps which weren't executed yet, are set to be skipped and the throwable is re-thrown.
        Should both, an exception and an error, occur, a StepException is thrown.
        Throws:
        StepException - If a StepException occurred in any Step.
        StepError - If an StepError and no StepExceptions occurred in any Step.

      • skipSteps

        public void skipSteps()
        Doesn't execute the behavior, but shows them in the report as skipped.
